I used to hide in this one room at the airport to fight cops and survive my bounties from players. (Yes, it was a simpler time.)
I remember a player brought a Rhino to the airport to get me but there was no way he wild be able to get me from inside this safe haven... so I thought...
Sure enough his blasts got me through the wall. That's just GTA physics.

WRITING.TITLE: I made $204,000 while watching NBA Playoffs (sort of)
WRITING.TEXT:
This isn't anything new so please don't hate on this post. I just want to share.
I basically start my Crystal Clear Out III playlist, plug in my controller, rubber band it so it doesn't time out, then go watch the game.
I come back 15+ minutes later and finish the mission. This nets me $40,800. I do this five times in a row in between commercial breaks or pause the Warriors game and go back to GTA.
After casual, semi-AFK, watching basketball, I walk away with $200k! How cool is that?

On the contrary, an un-upgraded weed business will break even faster than anything else.
But as far as pure profit, yes, coke is the winner long term.
You're so on point it's sad.

There's nothing to fix. It's not broken.
You're supposed to be doing work in an hostile environment. Your only real "fix" is to have associates, friends, crew mates to help and defend you.
That's the whole point of all of Rockstar's recent DLCs ... it's to get players to work together and interact. They know that multiplayer and player interaction has more legs than single-player story modes and no player interaction.
I feel bad for you and I don't understand people that fuck with other people's shit, either. But this isn't a broken system. It's designed to be like this.
This is great to know
You can if you're sitting in a non-CEO chair. Just a regular couch allows you to pull up your phone

Ugh. Sorry, man.
At least $300,000 is basically about one hour's worth of mission-grinding. Better than nothing I guess.
You want to see Savage in her happy place? Take her out to Harmony to do Crystal Clear Out II. OMG she wrecks.
Agreed

Because if this sliding scale, it's not imperative to finish asap or immediately at 4:00. If you're already past the 4:00 mark and the guy takes a another pass at the runway in the Titan, it's not the worst thing. If you're st 5:00, you might as well go to 6:00 for the bigger payout.
Of course, if the guy just thinks dragging everything out as long as possible is the best way to go, he's wrong. But going a bit long isn't always bullshit. :)
Honestly I think GTAVI will be the same (more detail, higher res) map BUT we will be able to travel using LSIA to fly (cutscene) to another area. Probably like San Francisco (San Fierro)

Crystal Clear Out III is my go-to. It's soooOoo easy and solo, pays $20,400 in 4-minutes. That $300,000 in an hour. That's silly money.
I usually kill everyone, then save one more guy and go do something else or look at my phone for three minutes.

Someone once asked "how many cars do I need to blow up to get into the bad sport lobby?"
And someone answered "a shit ton"
Moral of the story: you won't go into bad sport lobby for quitting some missions here and there. Next time this happens, quit.
It's temporary

To give you an estimate, source a car and sell a car (that's two missions) for $80,000 net.
You'll need to do this almost 90 times to make $7,000,000.
If it takes you 6-12 minutes per mission (two missions per car -- one source, one deliver,) that's 18-36 hours of gameplay. If you can get like 4-hours in a day, you can get $7M in one to two weeks.
Edit: math
Bummer. But nevertheless, the freshness will be fresher than ever!

Get GTAO. it's still amazing as it's ever been. And being a returning player, there are many free items for you.
Best thing is since there is new content and play modes, everything will seem fresh and new to you again!

My (estimated) Report:
**Tuesday April 18th, 2017**
* Money: ~$60,000,000 * Rank: 405
**Sunday, April 24, 2017**
* Money: ~$64,000,000 * Rank: 433
* bought Nero Custom
* bought Dewbauchee Spectre Custom
* bought weed business
* bought (4/20 discount) weed upgrades
* bought Innovation
* upgraded to large special crate warehouse (from medium)
* bought some clothes, etc
So I've netted probably $9,000,000-$10,000,000 or more

People don't like MC in comparison to CEO because CEO makes more money with smaller initial investment.
But the MC stuff is super fun to me. And, if you do it right, it's more money than CEO work after you've gone black on the balance sheet.
Ideally you just do CEO work and MC work together and balance your time between Blaine County and the city and you're having a great time.
I say buy the MC. DoD will still be there and you can earn enough to buy it with just a couple of coke shipments. :)

The only transfer of progress (that I know of) was from GTAV:O previous gen (Xbox, PS3) to new gen (XB1, PS4, PC)
Rockstar allowed you to bring in old characters and progress. They've also been rewarding players who bought the game on past and new gen machines by offering discounts, exclusive, and free items on in-game purchases and new dlc items.
They have since cut off transfers between consoles. I believe March 6 was the last day. Don't quote me on that.
So who knows what will happen for GTA6?
Could be a brand new type of game that takes place on a moon colony and it wouldn't make sense to transfer our current characters. :-D

The standard (free) Elegy is one of the best all-around cars in the game in terms of performance. It already outperforms half the supers around a typical track and is super easy to drive in freemode escaping cops and players.
If you factor in "value" as a criteria, the Elegy is easily the best car in the game for all around stellar performance.

WRITING.TITLE: A bit of good fortune to keep your hopes up
WRITING.TEXT:
Yesterday I delivered a full coke shipment and a full weed shipment after having recruited a friend to help -- turned out the coke was one delivery truck with three waves of motorcycle bad guys and I only had to go like 2 miles. Super easy. Could have soloed it.
The weed shipment was a bag I carried (and my MC Road captain had one too, but I imagine it would have only been one bag if I soloed it) and had to deliver about 2 miles. I had a chopper with me so it took like 60 seconds.
Easy shipments can happen! Don't lose hope!
(To be fair, my meth shipment was three PostOp trucks. I turned off the game to load in a different shipment method. I've yet to go back and see...)

One time I was in a lobby and these guys (with mics) were teaming up against me 3-on-one for the better part of an hour. I eventually ran off to Blaine County before they finally left me alone.
Shortly thereafter, there was an invite alert to do prison heist. I joined them and for some reason they thought it a good idea to invite someone they had just been fucking with for an hour.
Anyway we drive to the prison and I have the job of flying the getaway plane. We're about to finish and I blow up the plane on "accident"
We restart and I make the same "mistake."
I do this two more times but they kept restarting. Eventually it got to the point where they were too stubborn to kick me and let me win and I was too stubborn to quit out of boredom.
Finally I got booted from my internet connection. I thought they DDOSed me. But it's more likely my modem just crapped out.
This is not typical, of course, for people acting "mentally challenged," but it's one reason out of a million.
I think if you're just grinding RP, you can just do speed runs. I'm not sure the time affects RP rewards. I don't know. Maybe test the first couple runs to see if it changes.
I think 3000 or so. Don't remember (btw I've added three other missions to the playlist since I posted this yesterday. So don't be alarmed)
No, I think he was hitting on you 3

Yes there was another one but it got patched pretty quickly. They're really clamping down on this stuff now.
I bought the garage from he start so I didn't realize she bugged you about it. I can see how getting her to stop calling would be amazing. Amazing!

* Office garages look amazing.
* being able to mod your car with the built-in mod shop is amazing.
* you can also do Benny's mods without leaving your garage, which is amazing.
* consolidating two ten-car garages into one spot is amazing.
* I have the 60-car garage so having three floors of showroom-quality cars all in one place is amazing.
* having the extra 10-car garages scattered throughout the city (assuming you didn't trade them in) available as hideouts and for storing Sandkings, Dubsta 2s, or gang Mananas is a very welcomed utility and that's amazing too.
These are just my reasons. I'm sure other people might not care for it, which is fine. To each their own. Amazing.
TBH, doing Crystal Clear Out III like 150 times isn't as exciting as I like to make it appear. haha

Office garages are amazing. It's a good purchase. Maybe you bought things out of order, but don't regret the purchase. You'll want one eventually anyway

There was one mission where I had to get a van out of the impound at Vespucci PD HQ (the one with the big gates and usually has an armored police truck spawn inside it, also spawns Rhino from Pegasus)
I used sneak to walk into the gates and literally walked right past a cop standing near the gate all the way until I was about 10 feet away from the van I was supposed to steal. Then the stars came and they started shooting at me.
I used stealth as a joke and I'm not sure if it would have made a difference if I didn't or if it was just a glitch or whatever, but that was pretty amusing.
If nothing else, it's a placebo I'll probably start using from now on.

All missions pay the same. The payout depends on how quickly you finish the mission. The peak dollar/time ratio is the 4-minute range. Try making your mission last for 4-minutes exactly and you'll make more money than rushing

WRITING.TITLE: If you could only have one air, one land, one sea vehicle, which would you choose?
WRITING.TEXT:
Assume you can only keep one vehicle for land, for sea, and for air, which would you choose? Take into consideration, looks, utility, performance, and any other factor you find important...
Which would you choose and why?

As a counterpoint, I do 99% of my I/E car work with a Cargobob and "casually grind" car work (to the tune of +$11M commission over time.)
There's not a mission I can't do without a cargobob, the biggest hassle being the one where the amateur thief takes off in the car I want. For those I usually snipe him from afar before he gets a chance to drive away, but in about 50/50 on triggering his escape.
Outside of that mission, I do 95% of the cars at 100% damage-free for sourcing and delivering. So I suppose if someone crunched the numbers, the cargobob will pay for itself in repair costs before long.
But I'll concede it's not for everyone. It can get boring doing it this way and does take a gentle touch.
Same dlc as the jet pack.
Definitely Buzzard. I mean GTA:Online is pretty much GTA:Buzzard these days. You'll find life (and missions) in Los Santos is 100x better with a buzzard.

It's possible you lost it or saved over it.
You can report it to Rockstar and they might reimburse you. I lost my Elegy Retro a while back, reported it, and they reimbursed me the full amount, plus $100,000 for my troubles.

Personally I think it's quite fun. If you have friends to join your MC Club, all the more so. Plus, the MC president ability to instantly call any motorbike and dismiss (magically send back your personal vehicle-- any vehicle) is super handy. You can literally switch to MC, do what you need to, and switch back to doing whatever you were doing (provided you're not already in a CEO mission or other contact mission)
Just this ability makes it kinda worth it. But I suppose that all depends on what cash you have on hand
